channel.title: Debugging on Embedded Systems Design
channel.description: Recent content in Debugging on Embedded Systems Design

item.title: Configuring the UART on PSoC
item.description:
What is a UART (Universal Asynchronous Receiver/Transmitter)?

UART is one serial protocol used for communicating data between two digital devices (e.g., between the Pioneer Kit and the computer).

item.title: Connecting to the PSoC
item.description: Q: Help! My computer won’t connect properly to the PSoC. (insert one of several error messages here - KitProg version not expected, upgrade the firmware)

item.title: The First Three Questions You Should Ask When Debugging Your PCB and Possible Solutions
item.description:
Are Connections Continuous?

  • Conduct a continuity check on your board with a multimeter.
